review: After trying Apple TV, ROKU and several other streaming devices I chose  WDLIVE .Amazon Fire TV is more powerful, has the latest gimmicks and more storage. But, and this is a big but! They are following the same tired approach as ROKU and Apple TV.I want to play it all, the music and video stored on my server. FLAC, 16 bit, 24 bit, MP3, OGG, MP4,Does the Fire TV do 24bit audio? What about the other formats?Streaming from a service anyone of these boxes can do.You buy this box and you keep on paying for services. I want options, I want choices.How much of an effort would it be to actually get it right? Unless your worried about the big cable companies and the money you can make on the back end.WDLIVE is not that difficult to setup it's pretty much plug and play to stream from an online service, granted you need to point it to your media server if you have one. it could use more horse power and  storage. But it does play everything I throw at it!Amazon fire TV take a look at the WDLIVE, WDLIVE take a look at the Fire TV.APPLE and ROKU, new boxes please!Give me Fire hardware & WD software.
author: Richard Lajeunesse

review: I haven't used Amazon Fire TV. When I signed up for the free trial to try this product, I wasn't told I would need a HDMI cable, which is sold separately, in order for Fire TV to work.
